ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Checks if completed
Site Number
Notes: 900=Marlborough Hospital; 200=Maricopa Medical Center; 300=Memorial Hospital of Rhode Island; 400=Ohio State University Medical Center; 500=University of Arkansas Medical Center; 600=Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center; 700=University of Nebraska Medical Center; 800=University of Colorado Hospital; 100=University of Massachusetts Memorial Hospital; -888=Not Applicable; -999=Missing;

ElementDescription: Study Phase
Notes: 1=Phase 1: Treatment as Usual(TAU); 2=Phase 2: Screening Only; 3=Phase 3: Intervention; 4=Focus Groups; 5=Open Trial; 6=Randomized Trial; -888=Not Applicable; -999=Missing;

ElementDescription: Order of Presentation
Triage Time
Patients chart (e.g., hard copy, electronic, or other medical record) reviewed?
Race of study subject
ValueRange: American Indian/Alaska Native; Asian; Hawaiian or Pacific Islander; Black or African American; White; More than one race; Unknown or not reported; Other Non-White; Other

ElementDescription: Ethnicity of participant
ValueRange: Hispanic or Latino; Not Hispanic or Latino; Unknown

ElementDescription: Ethnic group
Visit related to psychiatric complaint?
Any documented thoughts or behaviors related to intentional self-harm, including suicidal and non-suicidal, on patient chart?
Notes: 0=Noscreening for self-harm documented; 1=No self harm present (patient screened but denied any past or current self-harm ideation/behavior); 2=Yes,currentself-harm(patient screened and endorsed self-harm ideation/behavior currently); 3=Yes,past self-harm ideation/behavior only(patient screened and endorsed self-harm ideation/behavior in past, but not currently); 4=Yes, self-harm, unknown time (patient screened and endorsed self-harm ideation/behavior, but unclear if past or current); -888=Not Applicable; -999=Missing;

ElementDescription: Was this self-harm ideation/behavior documented in the Patient Safety Screener?
From the Patient Safety Screener: Did the patient report that over the past 2 weeks, he/she had thoughts of killing him/herself?
From the Patient Safety Screener: Did the patient report attempting to kill him/herself ≤ 6 months before the current ED visit?
Did the RA approach the patient to try and administer eligibility screener?
Notes: 1=Yes, approached; 2=No,instate custody(jail, parole); 3=No, not currently community-dwelling (e.g., in psychiatric facility, rehab, nursing home, assisted living); 4=No, homeless; 5=No, too sick (e.g., intubated, persistent vomiting, persistent pain, unconscious, invasive procedures, isolation precautions, etc.); 6=No, too agitated, hostile, violent, abusive; 7=No, altered mental status; 8=No, insurmountable language barrier; 9=No, missed (i.e., patient was discharged, transferred, undergoing testing, or left before RA could approach, or RA shift ended); 10=No; -888=Not Applicable; -999=Missing;

ElementDescription: If other, please specify:
Comment on why subject not approached (optional)
Date eligibility screen began
Time eligibility screening began, military time
Are you willing to answer questions to determine if you are eligible for this study?
Over the past week, including today, have you had any thoughts of harming yourself?
When you had these thoughts, did you think about ending your life?
Over the past week, including today, have you actually tried to hurt yourself?
When you tried to hurt yourself, were you trying to kill yourself?
To participate, it is extremely important that we be able to reach you easily by phone. Do you have a phone that is always in service?

Would you be willing to answer questions over the phone on 5 different occasions over the course of the next year? Each call would take approximately 15 minutes and you would be paid $30 - $40 for your time.
Do you have a permanent address? (i.e. - not in a homeless shelter, half-way house, nursing home, psychiatric treatment facility, correctional facility)
Do you plan on staying where you currently live for the next 12 months?
Would you like to hear more about the study?
Eligibility Screen completed?
Reason eligibility screen not completed
Notes: 1=Instate custody (jail, parole); 2=Not currently community-dwelling (e.g., in psychiatric facility, rehab, nursing home, assisted living); 3=Homeless; 4=Too sick; 5=Agitated, hostile, violent, or abusive; 6=Altered mental status (intoxicated, unconscious, hallucinating); 7=Insurmountable language barrier; 8=Other; 9=Refused; 10=Idea to renrollment cap reached; -888=Not Applicable; -999=Missing;

ElementDescription: If other, please specify:
Was the patient enrolled into the study?
Record the Subject ID #
Staff code number of person completing this form
Form used/assessment name
Is this person able to speak, read and understand English?
Eligibility Criteria: Being evaluated for suicidal thoughts or actions
Eligibility Criteria: Age >=18 years
Eligibility Criteria: Deemed medically stable by ED physician
Eligibility Criteria: Do you currently live in a group home or other supervised setting?
Eligibility Criteria: Do you have a telephone number where we could reach you in one week for a brief phone call?
Eligibility Criteria: Do you currently have at least one firearm stored in your home?
Eligibility Criteria: If patient NOT consented and enrolled in the study, why?
Subject's education (school and preschool)
Marital status
Employment situation? Explain briefly
Subject's gender OTHER describe
Child's/study subject  Race specify
Is there someone (a friend or family member) with you in the ER right now? (choose all that apply)
Notes: 0 = No, I came alone ; 1 = No, they were here but left ; 2 = Yes, my spouse/partner/significant other ; 3 = Yes, some other family member ; 4 = Yes, a friend ; 5 = Yes, someone from my work ; 6 = Yes, a caseworker ; 7 = Yes, someone else: ; 8 = Refused/skipped ; 9 = Don't know

ElementDescription: Is there someone (a friend or family member) with you in the ER right now? Other: specify
If there is someone (a friend or family member) with you in the ER right now, is the person here someone you turn to for help when you are feeling unsafe?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes, he/she is the main person I turn to; 2 = Yes, he/she is one of a group of people I turn to; 8 = Refused/skipped; 9 = Don't know

ElementDescription: Do you currently live alone?
If you do not live alone, then who else lives with you? (choose all that apply)
Notes: 1 = My spouse/partner/significant other; 2 = Another adult; 3 = At least one child (age < 18 years); 8 = Refused; 9 = Don't know

ElementDescription: If at least one child lives with you, then how many children live in the house, and what are their ages?
Notes: Enter number and age of each

ElementDescription: Are you currently enrolled in any kind of outpatient mental health care (like with a therapist or psychiatrist)?
Are you currently under arrest or otherwise in police custody?
Was this eligibility screening (and/or enrollment) completed in person or via phone?
